intro: Tovomita pithecobia, commonly known as the monkey tree, is a climbing plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by pod-like fruits containing seeds. It is often found in humid, shaded environments within forests. Its botanical features make it an important component of the ecosystem in its native habitat.
